intro: Centaurea cheiranthifolia subsp. willdenowii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cornflower, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in dry grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species in its native habitat.
